content.description:
A fantastic sustained exercise in technical corner climbing, the Professor will not fail to educate you. This route does not get the travel it deserves. 

  An in-your-face start leads to easier climbing until you gain the corner proper. A tricky sequence leads to a small rest at the undercling rail. From here sustained, technical, and difficult climbing leads to a final sting in the tail to reach the anchor. 

  A proud onsite.
content.protection:
9 protection bolts and a two bolt rap anchor 

  To avoid a cross-loading situation the second bolt is intended to be clipped with only a biner at the end of the equipped chain draw.
content.location: The left side of the Booty Wall at the right hand side of the often wet cave/hole.

content.description: A very bouldery route with two distinct cruxes at the bottom and the top of the pitch.  Save some juice for the finish - it doesn't let off until you can lick the anchors!
content.location: the first bolted pitch you come to on the approach trail to upper west (excluding the booty wall).  Just left of the rock slide talus.

content.description:
Begin at the lowest point of the slab, just left of the tree. A gaston/high step leads to good edges and some hard moves past pockets. Move out to good feet on the arete at the very top. 

  Top out and move left to a cordelette rap station

Up the dirty  slab to a stance. Squeeze out over the void with great exposure to the end of the chimney. Top out with good feet on the arete. Stays dry in the rain. 

  Move left to a cordelette rap station.
A few short but fun sport climbs and one little finger crack.
